titles.title: Mäzmur, Antiphones for Sundays of the year / Mǝʿǝraf, The Common of the Office / Zǝmmare, Eucharistic hymns / Mäwaśǝʾt, Antiphonary for feasts and funeral service

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäzmur, Antiphones for Sundays of the year (fols. 3ra-93rb) II) Mǝʿǝraf, The Common of the Office (fols. 93va-143vb) II-1) Wazema, The Office of Vigils (fols. 93va-108vb l.3) II-2) Mäwäddǝs, The Sunday Office (fols. 108vb l.4-133rb l.2) II-3) Kǝśtät zä-ʾaryam, The festive Office (fols. 133rb l.3-143vb) - Table of halleluiatic chants (fols. 142rb-143vb) III) Zǝmmare, Eucharistic hymns (fols. 144ra-147rb) IV) Mäwaśǝʾt, Antiphonary for feasts and funeral service (fols. 147va-162rb)
Additiones 1-4.

donors.donor: According to Additio 2, the Ms. was purchased and donated to the church of Maryam ʾAwaḫe (the same church as Gänaḥti Maryam or a different one?) by Bäkwǝrä Ṣǝyon. His name is also mentioned in the supplication formula on fol. 32va l.11.

dcomments.dcomment: King Täklä Giyorgis I (r. 1779-84, 1788-89, 1794-95, 1975-96, 1800) is mentioned in the supplication formulas on fols. 124va-b and 138rb l.11.

txstates.txstate: The front board is detached from the textblock. The spine cover is damaged. Many fols. are affected by humidity.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the dark brown leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: criss-cross, x-form, double circle, interlaced line fillet, double line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Edges of the turn-ins are sewn together. Traces of endband stitches are visible on the spine cover. Rows of small holes are visible on the spine cover. Quire A is reinforced with a parchment guard.

inks.ink: Black, red (vivid and strong vermilion, strong amaranth)

txfolios.txfolio: Pictures of the head and tail edges of the Ms. are missing.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(8/fols. 35r-42v) – VI(8/fols. 43r-50v) – VII(8/fols. 51r-58v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 59r-66v) – [፱]IX(8/fols. 67r-74v) – ፲X(8/fols. 75r-82v) – ፲፩XI(10/fols. 83r-92v) – ፲፪XII(8/fols. 93r-100v) – ፲፫XIII(8/fols. 101r-108v) – [፲፬]XIV(8/fols. 109r-116v) – ፲፭XV(9; s.l.: 7, stub after 2/fols. 117r-125v) – ፲፮XVI(8/fols. 126r-133v) – [፲፯]XVII(8/fols. 134r-141v) – [፲፰]XVIII(8/fols. 142r-149v) – ፲፱XIX(10/fols. 150r-159v) – XX(2; s.l.: 1, stub after 2; 2, stub after 2/fols. 160r-162v) – B(1; s.l.: 1, stub before 1/fol. 163r-v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the king; a few lines on the incipit page of Texts I-IV; the initial line of Texts II-1-3; names of sections occasionally followed by feast names (wazema, mäzmur, zǝmmare, mäwaśǝʾt); names of supplications, antiphons and their abbreviations (e.g., mästäbqʷǝʿ, maḫlet, sälam, bä-5-tu, ʾabun, ʾaryam, ʾǝsmä lä-ʿaläm, kwǝllǝkkǝmu, zä-ʾamlakiyä, zä-yǝʾǝze, yǝtbaräk); names of other chants (e.g., mǝlṭan, mǝsbak, mǝqnay, mǝdgam, qǝnnǝwat, ʿǝzl); names of feasts and other occasions; the word wängel “gospel” in Text I; the word mǝʿǝraf and its abbreviations in Text II; musical notation: intratextual signs (e.g., ʾaryam, yǝgäbru, qalä ʿawadi, ʾaklilä, kokäb, ḥaḍä), entire or elements of marginal signs; elements of the Table of halleluiatic chants; directives for the ministers (e.g., ǝm-qǝdmä, wä-dǝḫrehu, wä-ʾǝmzǝ, yǝbe diyaqon); chains of red and black dots separating groups of antiphons; elements of the punctuation signs, Ethiopic numerals or their elements. Sometimes only two or three initial letters of a word are rubricated. The name of the donor is rubricated in strong amaranth.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ማኅ፡/ማኅሌ፡ for ማኅሌት፡ ምልጣ፡ for ምልጣን፡ መዝሙ፡ for መዝሙር፡ ም፡/ምዕራ፡ for ምዕራፍ፡ ስብ፡/ስብሐ፡ for ስብሐተ፡ ነግህ፡ እስመ፡/እስመ፡ ለዓ፡ for እስመ፡ ለዓለም፡ አምላ፡ for አምላኪየ፡ አር፡ for አርያም፡ አራራ፡ for አራራይ፡ ይት፡/ይትባ፡/ይትባረ፡ for ይትባረክ፡ ዝማ፡ for ዝማሬ፡ ዘይእ፡ for ዘይእዜ፡ ሃ፡ for ሃሌሉያ፡ ይ፡ ሕ፡ for ይቤ፡ ሕዝብ፡ ይ፡ ዲ፡ for ይቤ፡ ዲያቆን፡ Repeated versicles are often written in an abbreviated form, e.g., ኢ፤ እ፤ stands for ኢትፍርሂ፡ እም፡ ንፈጽሞ፡ ገድለኒ (fol. 79rb l.9).

additional.cont: Fols. 1va-2ra: Excerpt from Mäwaśəˀt, Antiphonary for feasts and funeral service, for the feast of the Martyrs of Nagran (zä-Nagran).
additional.det: The note is written in the main hand.

additional.cont: Fol. 2rb: Purchase note.
additional.det: According to the note the Ms. was purchased by qesä gäbäz Bäkwǝrä Ṣǝyon in the time of däğğazmač Säbagadǝs (sic for Säbagadis, Subagadis r. 1822-31) for 5 ʾamole-salt bars and donated to the church of Maryam ʾAwaḫe (cf. also Mss. GMG-002 Additiones 4 and 5, GMG-003 Additio 7).

additional.cont: Fol. 163r: ˀAsmat-prayer.
additional.det: The prayer is written in the same fine hand as Additio 4.
The prayer is written in the same fine hand as Additio 3.

extras.extra: - Omitted passages are written in the upper margins of fols. 10va, 30rb, 86r, 138vb, 140rb. - Tämälläs-signs, in the shape of a cross, indicating the place where the omissions, written in the margin, belong: fols. 57vb l.5, 152va l.2. - Pen trial: fol. 1r. - Minor notes, writing exercises: fols. 49v, 50r, 50v, 51r, 52r, 53r, 140r, 154v, 156v, 162v, 163v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Undecorated quire marks are written in the left upper corner: fols. 59r: ፰,75r: ፲,83r: ፲፩, 93r: ፲፪, 101r: ፲፫, 117r: ፲፭, 126r: ፲፮, 150r: ፲፱.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Feast names are crudely written in pen in the upper margin: ዘሕማማት: fol. 61r ዘትንሣኤ: fol. 63rb.
